headline: The Parable of the Small Light
description: A parable about humility, light, and the quiet duty of preserving goodness even when overshadowed.
author: Unnamed
whyItMatters: This parable articulates the Bloom’s theology of small light — the truth that even a humble flame carries divine purpose, especially when overshadowed. It reveals the value of ritual and steadiness in an age obsessed with efficiency and visibility.

articleExcerpt: “Though it pales beside the sun, all light is welcome. And one day, should the sun be darkened, this little flame will shine all the greater for its days of humbleness.”
sourceFragments: A great Tree stood at a crossroads, beside a small way station where weary travelers sometimes stopped.
Each morning, without fail, the old clerk would walk to the Great Tree and light a small lantern in its low branches.
Why light a lantern that serves no purpose?
Though it pales beside the sun, all light is welcome.
